definitions.text: a process of increasing by addition (as to a collection or group)
examples: the art collection grew through accession

definitions.text: (civil law) the right to all of that which your property produces whether by growth or improvement
something added to what you already have
examples: the librarian shelved the new accessions
he was a new addition to the staff

definitions.text: agreeing with or consenting to (often unwillingly)
examples: accession to such demands would set a dangerous precedent

definitions.text: the act of attaining or gaining access to a new office or right or position (especially the throne)
make a record of additions to a collection, such as a library
